item.title: What My Bones Know
item.description: Incredible memoir. One of the best books I’ve read about healing from abuse, dysfunction, and trauma. So much to relate to on every page (and not just because she had the same Jimmy Eat World song as a lifeline in the early aughts).

item.title: Subtle Blood
item.description: I might have accidentally read Subtle Blood again, since I might have accidentally experienced a vivid dream of Will, Kim, Phoebe, and Maisie on a Parisian adventure (cameo by Teddy Molyneaux, of course), and upon waking, might have accidentally been distraught that that book wasn’t going to exist.

item.title: The Sugared Game
item.description: The reason it takes me a week to read a book that I literally can’t put down is because I read it twice.

item.title: Slippery Creatures
item.description: My favorite KJ Charles yet. I should probably wait till the end of the trilogy to make declarative statements, but there’s WWI spies and bookshops and gentle friendship despite odds and this is as far into my wheelhouse as you can get until, like, sheep herding or Belgium is involved.

item.title: Annals of the Former World
item.description: I’m glad I’m not beyond the age where books I read can change the way I see the world. If that is an age you can reach, I don’t want to.
